physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood glucose: 626 mg/dl (34.8 mmol/liter), HbA1c: 7.7% (normal range: 4.3–5.6%)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Diminished blood C-peptide: 0.35 ng/ml (normal range: 1.0–2.5 ng/ml), Negative for anti-GAD antibody
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Insulin requirements gradually decreased and insulin could be stopped at 12 months of age; currently maintains normal HbA1c without any treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Not obese; Body mass index 17.8; Negative for anti-GAD antibody
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially kept HbA1c at less than 6.5% for 2 years; blood glucose levels gradually elevated with HbA1c at 6.8–7.3% at 25 years of age.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No significant findings in other family members at initial visit.
